title: Any new Golf is a big deal – but will VW's electrification strategy cost it dear?
text:
The arrival of a new Volkswagen Golf is always an important event; this is, after all, the biggest-selling model for one of the world’s largest manufacturers. More than that, it’s a car buyers across the world adore. A new one, then, is a big deal.

And yet, for the first time in its 45-year history, the Golf faces competition from within its own family, in the form of the ID.3 – another family hatchback of very similar proportions, albeit one that’s strictly powered purely by electricity.

A very clear decision has been taken by Volkswagen to demarcate the two models, which bucks the current industry trend. Other manufacturers are starting to fold electric cars into their standard model ranges,...
description: The arrival of a new Volkswagen Golf is always an important event;
